tn.ref: Has Yahweh spoken only with Moses? Has he not spoken also with us?
tn.text: Miriam and Aaron use these questions to complain that Moses had so much authority and they did not. This can be expressed as a statement. AT: "Yahweh has not spoken only with Moses. He has also spoken with us." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The word "Now" hear draws attention to the important point that follows.
"Now" is used to mark a break in the main story line. The narrator tells background information about Moses' character. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
The shape of the cloud is spoken of as if it were a pillar. AT: "a cloud shaped like a pillar" or "a tall cloud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: My servant Moses is not like that
tn.text: "I do not speak to Moses like that"

tn.ref: He is faithful in all my house
tn.text: Here "my house" represents the nation of Israel. Being faithful in God's house represents being faithful in leading Israel. AT: "Moses leads my people faithfully" or "Moses is the one whom I trust to lead my people Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: So why are you unafraid to speak against my servant, against Moses?
tn.text: Yahweh asks this question to rebuke Miriam and Aaron. It can be translated as a statement. AT: "You should be afraid to speak against my servant, against Moses." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The phrase "against Moses" clarifies that he is the "servant" of whom Yahweh speaks. AT: "against my servant, Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Yahweh's anger is spoken of as if it were a fire. AT: "Yahweh became very angry with them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Leprosy turned Miriam's skin white. AT: "became very white" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: do not hold this sin against us
tn.text: To hold people's sin against them is to say that they are guilty for their sin. Here it represents punishing them for their sin. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Please do not let her be like a dead newborn whose flesh is half consumed
tn.text: Miriam's leprosy would cause her body to decay until she died. The flesh being decayed is spoken of as if it were eaten. AT: "Please do not let her be like a dead newborn baby whose flesh is half decayed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: If her father had spit in her face
tn.text: This describes something that could have happened but did not. Spitting in someone's face was a terrible insult. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]]and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: Miriam was shut outside the camp
tn.text: Being sent out of the camp and not being allowed to go back in is spoken of as if there were a door that was closed behind her. AT: "Miriam was sent outside the camp" or "Miriam was kept outside the camp" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Miriam was shut outside the camp
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses shut Miriam outside the camp" or "Moses sent Miriam outside the camp" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a place in the desert. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:num:11:33|11:35]].
